Replace.Text: A country that made an alliance with the dragon

The game starts with the activation of "Currency" and "Astronomy" [ICON_TechBoosted] Eureka. The Hexin Chamber of Commerce and the Port gain [ICON_Culture] Culture equal to the adjacent bonus. Each specialized area, farm and mine in the destination city gives [ICON_TradeRoute] +2 [ICON_Production] Production, +2 [ICON_Food] Food, and +3 [ICON_Gold] Gold. Each [ICON_TradingPost] passed by the trade route gives +1 [ICON_Science] Technology and [ICON_Culture] Culture. Each specialized area, each country encountered, and unlocking "Currency" and "Banking" technology will give +1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Capacity (+1 more if the city builds a specialized area for the first time). Merchants can be purchased with Faith.

Unlock "Astrology" technology at the start of the game. Regions gain an additional adjacency bonus and a little extra [ICON_Faith] Faith (except for Holy Sites). City Centers gain +3 [ICON_Faith] Faith when in contact with Farms and Mines, and double this output and add 2 [ICON_Culture] Culture when in contact with Regions. Cities with Monuments gain +15% [ICON_Production] Productivity when building Regions. Cities gain [ICON_Production] Productivity and 25% [ICON_Culture] Culture each turn equal to 25% of the [ICON_Faith] Faith gained each turn.
Lugnica is a unique Medieval unit that replaces the Knight. It is more powerful than the Knight.

Lugnica's unique building. +4 [ICON_Culture] Culture, [ICON_Faith] Faith and Influence, and +1 Amenity and higher Defense for the city it's in. This building has 3 Great Works slots. After unlocking the Political Philosophy Civic, [ICON_Faith] can be used to purchase Light and Heavy Cavalry units. If a Trade Route passes through this building, it will receive double [ICON_Gold] from the destination region. Only one building can be built.
Lugnica Kingdom's unique unit: Lugnica Kingdom's Royal Guard Knights
Lugnica Kingdom's characteristic buildings: Lugnica Royal City
Anastasia Hesin as leader of the Kingdom of Lugnica featured area: Hesin Chamber of Commerce
Anastasia Hussin's featured district when she is leader of the Kingdom of Lugnica. It replaces the Commercial Center and is cheaper to build. It does not require a population limit to build.
As long as you are still alive, and as long as you can touch or grab anything with your hands, it will all become someone else's property.
You know I can't be a lady in this kind of clothes, right?

Occupied cities have a very low chance of rebellion. Cities with [ICON_GOVERNOR] Governor gain +2 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities. All cities can carry out the special projects "Firut Escape Plan!" and "Firut Escape Plan! (True)". After unlocking the Political Philosophy Municipality, obtain the special unit "Reinhard van Astraea".

Firut's First Knight! This is a special unit when he is a leader. It cannot be trained and can only be owned by one at a time. It can only be purchased with faith points. It can act immediately after purchase and has a lifespan of 30 turns. It has extremely high attack power and mobility and can attack from a distance. When fighting against a unit with a higher combat power than itself, its combat power is doubled. After killing a unit, it gains 75% of the culture and faith points based on the attack power of the killed unit. When Reinhardt's health is zero, it is immediately teleported to the capital. When Reinhardt is on the field, he and the heavy cavalry unit will cause full damage to the city wall. Cannot occupy the city.
Convert city productivity into gold (15%), and gain a pioneer unit in the city after the project is completed.
The Warrior Maiden of the Dukedom of Karsten
Even if we go to war in the future, I will still treat you with friendship.
Aid from First Knight Felix Argyle
Unit recovery is enhanced, and health can be restored after attacking. (Assisted by First Knight Felix Argyle)

Have higher diplomatic visibility. All military units gain +1 [ICON_Faith] faith output and gain the additional ability "First Knight Phyllis's Support". You can get [ICON_Gold] gold coins when recruiting units. Each ally gives +2 combat power to all units. For each military unit obtained, you will get an additional 10 [ICON_Culture] culture value (including but not limited to production, purchase and recruitment of city-state units, and the additional [ICON_Culture] culture value will increase with the change of era). Get an additional wildcard slot.
+{1_num} [ICON_Culture] Culture value comes from adjacent {1_Num : plural 1?region; other?region;}.
